com.tuya.record

Class TuyaRingBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tuya.record.TuyaRingBuffer

  • public final class TuyaRingBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
    A ring buffer backed by a byte array. Very memory efficient.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  TuyaRingBuffer.PeekCallback
      For efficient access to elements in the buffer.
      class  TuyaRingBuffer.ShortView 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TuyaRingBuffer(int capacity)
      Creates a ring buffer that can store up to the given number of bytes.

      • TuyaRingBuffer

        public TuyaRingBuffer(int capacity)
        Creates a ring buffer that can store up to the given number of bytes.
        Parameters:
        capacity - How many bytes can be stored in the buffer.

    • Method Detail

      • sizeUsed

        public final int sizeUsed()
        Returns:
        How many bytes are stored in the buffer.

      • sizeTotal

        public final int sizeTotal()
        Returns:
        How many bytes can be stored in the buffer in total.

      • sizeFree

        public final int sizeFree()
        Returns:
        How many bytes are free in the buffer.

      • push

        public final int push(byte... bytes)
        Adds elements to the end of the buffer.
        Parameters:
        bytes - Adds entire array to buffer.
        Returns:
        Number of bytes added. It may not insert every element when the buffer has not enough free space.

      • push

        public final int push(byte[] bytes,
                      int index)
        Adds elements to the end of the buffer.
        Parameters:
        bytes - Array that contains elements to be added.
        index - Where to begin extracting elements.
        Returns:
        Number of bytes added. It may not insert every element when the buffer has not enough free space.

      • push

        public final int push(byte[] bytes,
                      int index,
                      int length)
        Adds elements to the end of the buffer.
        Parameters:
        bytes - Array that contains elements to be added.
        index - Where to begin extracting elements.
        length - How many elements to extract.
        Returns:
        Number of bytes added. It may not insert every element when the buffer has not enough free space.

      • overrunPush

        public final void overrunPush(byte... bytes)
        This version of the push method will overrun. This means that if the buffer is full then the oldest elements will be overwritten by the newest ones.
        Parameters:
        bytes - Adds entire array to buffer.

      • overrunPush

        public final void overrunPush(byte[] bytes,
                              int index)
        This version of the push method will overrun. This means that if the buffer is full then the oldest elements will be overwritten by the newest ones.
        Parameters:
        bytes - Array that contains elements to be added.
        index - Where to begin extracting elements.

      • overrunPush

        public final void overrunPush(byte[] bytes,
                              int index,
                              int length)
        This version of the push method will overrun. This means that if the buffer is full then the oldest elements will be overwritten by the newest ones.
        Parameters:
        bytes - Array that contains elements to be added.
        index - Where to begin extracting elements.
        length - How many elements to extract.

      • peek

        public final byte[] peek(int length)
        Retrieves elements from the buffer.
        Parameters:
        length - How many elements to retrieve.
        Returns:
        Array of elements retrieved. Length may be less than requested if buffer doesn't have enough elements.

      • peek

        public final int peek(byte[] bytes)
        Retrieves elements from the buffer and stores them in another array.
        Parameters:
        bytes - Where elements will be stored. The size of the array indicates how many elements will be retrieved.
        Returns:
        Number of elements that were copied.

      • peek

        public final int peek(byte[] bytes,
                      int index,
                      int length)
        Retrieves elements from the buffer and stores them in another array.
        Parameters:
        bytes - Where elements will be stored.
        index - Where to start placing elements in the given array.
        length - How many elements to copy.
        Returns:
        Number of elements that were copied.

      • peek

        public final int peek(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer)
        Retrieves elements from the buffer and places them in a ByteBuffer.
        Parameters:
        byteBuffer - Destination. The remaining size of the buffer indicates how many elements to retrieved.
        Returns:
        Number of elements placed into the given ByteBuffer object.

      • peek

        public final int peek(java.nio.ByteBuffer byteBuffer,
                      int length)
        Retrieves elements from the buffer and places them in a ByteBuffer.
        Parameters:
        byteBuffer - Destination.
        length - How many elements to retrieve.
        Returns:
        Number of elements placed into the given ByteBuffer object.

      • peek

        public final void peek(TuyaRingBuffer.PeekCallback cb)
        Retrieves elements from the buffer with indirect access.
        Parameters:
        cb - The borrow method will be called at least once. It will be called if the buffer is empty.

      • pop

        public final byte[] pop(int length)
        Removes elements from the buffer and returns them.
        Parameters:
        length - How many elements to remove.
        Returns:
        Array of removed elements. May not remove the same number of elements as requested if the buffer did not have that many to begin with.

      • pop

        public final int pop(byte[] bytes)
        Moves elements from the buffer to the given array.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The destination array. Its size determines how many elements to remove.
        Returns:
        Number of elements removed. It may be less than the size of the given array if the buffer does not have enough elements to fill the array.

      • pop

        public final int pop(byte[] bytes,
                     int index)
        Moves elements from the buffer to the given array.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The destination array. Its size determines how many elements to remove.
        index - Where to begin placing elements in the array.
        Returns:
        Number of elements removed.

      • pop

        public final int pop(byte[] bytes,
                     int index,
                     int length)
        Moves elements from the buffer to the given array.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The destination array.
        index - Where to begin placing elements in the array.
        length - How many elements to remove.
        Returns:
        Number of elements removed. It may be less than the size of the provided length if the buffer does not have enough elements to fill the array.

      • drop

        public final void drop(int elements)
        Removes elements from the buffer.
        Parameters:
        elements - Number of elements to remove.

      • clear

        public final void clear()
        Removes every element from the buffer. The buffer will go back to its initial state.

      • shortView

        public final TuyaRingBuffer.ShortView shortView()
        Creates a view of this byte buffer that allows you to access its elements as shorts.
